Package ispd.motor.workload.impl

Class GlobalWorkloadGenerator

java.lang.Object
ispd.motor.workload.impl.task.TaskBuilder
ispd.motor.workload.impl.RandomicWorkloadGenerator
ispd.motor.workload.impl.GlobalWorkloadGenerator
All Implemented Interfaces:
WorkloadGenerator
public class GlobalWorkloadGenerator extends RandomicWorkloadGenerator
Generates a workload with randomly-decided sizes from a collection of uniform intervals, and evenly distributes the tasks of such workload across all masters in a GridQueueNetwork.
Some particularities:
  • This class generates task ids sequentially, starting from 0 .
  • This class generates task creation times from an exponential distribution.
See Also:
  • RandomicWorkloadGenerator
  • SequentialIntSupplier
  • Distribution.nextExponential(double)

  • Constructor Details

    • GlobalWorkloadGenerator

      public GlobalWorkloadGenerator (int taskCount, double compMin, double compMax, double compAvg, double compProb, double commMin, double commMax, double commAvg, double commProb, int taskCreationTime)
      Instantiate a generator with the given properties and interval bounds .
      Parameters relating to the generation of the computation and communication size of the task are used in a two-stage uniform distribution.
      Parameters:
      taskCount - number of tasks to generate
      compMin - computation distribution minimum
      compMax - computation distribution maximum
      compAvg - computation distribution interval split
      compProb - computation distribution first interval probability
      commMin - communication distribution minimum
      commMax - communication distribution maximum
      commAvg - communication distribution interval split
      commProb - communication distribution first interval probability
      taskCreationTime - task creation time (beta for an exponential distribution)
      See Also:
      • TwoStageUniform
      • Distribution.nextExponential(double)

    • GlobalWorkloadGenerator

      public GlobalWorkloadGenerator (int taskCount, int taskCreationTime, TwoStageUniform computation, TwoStageUniform communication)
      Instantiate a generator with the given properties, and that uses the given TwoStageUniforms to generate task computation and communication sizes, respectively.
      Parameters:
      taskCount - number of tasks to generate
      taskCreationTime - task creation time (beta for an exponential distribution)
      computation - TwoStageUniform that will generate task computation size
      communication - TwoStageUniform that will generate task computation size
      See Also:
      • TwoStageUniform
      • Distribution.nextExponential(double)

    • formatForIconicModel

      public String formatForIconicModel()
      The iconic model format for this workload generator consists of:
      • The configuration for computation and communication (respectively) distributions for task size. Their values (except for TwoStageUniform.firstIntervalProbability() are formatted as integral values. Furthermore, the order the values are outputted is inconsistent between them
      • An extra 0
      • The taskCreationTime
      • The RandomicWorkloadGenerator.taskCount
      Returns:
      iconic-model fitting string representation of how the generator is currently configured.
      See Also:
      • TwoStageUniform

    • toString

      public String toString()
      The string representation for this workload generator includes its task count, task creation time parameter, and distributions for generating computation and communication sizes.
      Specified by:
      toString in interface WorkloadGenerator
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      human-readable string representation of how the generator is currently configured.

    • makeTaskUser

      protected String makeTaskUser (Processing master)
      The task user decided by this workload generator is simply the owner of the Processing that will host the task.
      Specified by:
      makeTaskUser in class TaskBuilder
      Parameters:
      master - Processing that hosts information about which user the task will be linked with.
      Returns:
      user id of the owner of the given master, to be used to generate a new task.
      See Also:
      • Processing.getProprietario()

    • makeTaskCreationTime

      protected double makeTaskCreationTime()
      The task creation time generation involves an exponential distribution, with beta equaling the task creation time configured for this instance.
      Specified by:
      makeTaskCreationTime in class TaskBuilder
      Returns:
      task creation time (in seconds), to be used to make a new task.
